channel.title: The Pudding
channel.description: The Pudding is an editorial publication that explains ideas debated in culture with visual essays.

item.title: How you play Spades is how you play life
item.description: First-of-its kind data exploration of Spades in the African-American community

item.description: Millions of comments, posts, and links, charted.

item.title: “I Kissed A Girl” to “Call Me By Your Name”
item.description: A story about hearing yourself in same-gender lyrics for the first time

item.title: Help a Computer Win the New Yorker Cartoon Caption Contest
item.description: This is an experiment to see if an AI program can produce humor.

item.title: How many artists overshadow their band after going solo?
item.description: What the data say about Beyoncé, Nick Lachey, and others.

item.title: Get out of your geographic music bubble
item.description: The songs that are popular, far away from you.

item.title: How Science Came Together During COVID-19
item.description: A look at the global research effort to combat the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: The Naked Truth
item.description: How the names of 6,816 complexion products can reveal bias in beauty.

item.title: Wine & Math: A Model Pairing
item.description: We built a model that attempts to predict a wine’s quality.

item.title: Nothing Breaks Like A.I. Heart
item.description: An essay about artificial and emotional intelligence and finding an ending.

item.title: The Cultural Borders of Songs
item.description: We mapped last month’s #1 songs in 3,000 places.

item.title: Introducing the Live Music Analyst
item.description: An auditory comparison of 770 artists' live and studio tracks

item.title: We created a speaker rider. Journalism didn’t have one.
item.description: Everyone needs to work together to make events more inclusive.

item.title: Every time someone says cool in Community
item.description: Watch all 412 cools from Abed, and others.
